description.narrative: Strengthened national capacities for political commitment to planning, budgeting and coordination for the scaling up of interventions, which contributes to Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Pregnant women, nursing mothers, and children under 5 have access and use equitable public and community facilities for the prevention and treatment of malnutrition, including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national capacities for political commitment to planning, budgeting and coordination for the scaling up of interventions

description.narrative:
A national nutrition and feeding policy action plan was drawn up and budgeted, including a major component on stunting prevention. A food guide whose contents promote good nutritional practices was been developed.
The emergency nutrition sector plan was updated and implemented during the post-cyclone Kenneth response in June 2019. A national assessment of prevention and risk reduction capacity was carried out, including in the area of nutrition. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) National Multisectoral Committee for Nutrition available and functional
Existence of a functional national multisectoral committee for nutrition
Implementation of a national strategy to prevent stunting in children
Child sensitive national risk management plans that adress nutrition related risks in humanitarian situation are in place
